intro: Begonia villigera, commonly known as the mountain begonia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
